com.ibm.mobile.applaunch.android.api

Class AppLaunch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mobile.applaunch.android.api.AppLaunch

  • public class AppLaunch
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton that serves as an entry point to IBM Cloud AppLaunch service communication.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void destroy(AppLaunchListener appLaunchListener)
      This Methode clears the stored service information and unregisters the device from the IBM Cloud AppLaunch service.

      Invoke this method to display the in-app messages if present.

      This returns the instance of AppLaunch Class.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AppLaunch getInstance()
        This returns the instance of AppLaunch Class. This singleton instance should be used for all AppLaunch activity.
        Returns:
        AppLaunch Instance

      • initialize

        public void initialize(android.app.Application context,
                       ICRegion region,
                       java.lang.String appGuid,
                       java.lang.String clientSecret,
                       AppLaunchConfig config,
                       AppLaunchUser user,
                       AppLaunchListener appLaunchListener)
        The required initializer for the AppLaunch SDK. This method will intialize the AppLaunch with credentials, user and configuration details.
        Parameters:
        context - this is the Context of the application from getApplicationContext()
        region - IBM Cloud region suffix specifies the location where the AppLaunch service is hosted
        appGuid - app GUID value
        clientSecret - appLaunch client secret value
        config - appLaunch client configuration object
        user - appLaunch client user object
        appLaunchListener - AppLaunchListener is callback function. In the case of a successful intialization, the engagements JSON is returned in the AppLaunchResponse. In the case of a unsuccessful completion, the error code and the information is returned in the AppLaunchFailResponse object

      • destroy

        public void destroy(AppLaunchListener appLaunchListener)
        This Methode clears the stored service information and unregisters the device from the IBM Cloud AppLaunch service.
        Parameters:
        appLaunchListener - AppLaunchListener callback function. In the case of a successful completion, the success information is returned in the AppLaunchResponse. In the case of a unsuccessful completion, the error information is returned in the AppLaunchFailResponse.

      • isFeatureEnabled

        public boolean isFeatureEnabled(java.lang.String featureCode)
                         throws AppLaunchException
        Checks to see if the feature code specified is present.
        Parameters:
        featureCode - This is the feature code value
        Returns:
        Boolean value. True if feature is enabled and false if feature is not enabled
        Throws:
        AppLaunchException - whenever applaunch service is not initialized

      • getPropertyOfFeature

        public java.lang.String getPropertyOfFeature(java.lang.String featureCode,
                                             java.lang.String propertyCode)
                                      throws AppLaunchException
        This API returns the variable for the feature code.
        Parameters:
        featureCode - This is the feature code value
        propertyCode - This is the property code value
        Returns:
        String value of the property or Empty string if property/feature doesn't exist
        Throws:
        AppLaunchException - whenever applaunch service is not initialized

      • sendMetrics

        public void sendMetrics(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> metrics)
        This Methode used to send metrics information to the IBM Cloud AppLaunch service.
        Parameters:
        metrics - Array of metric codes.

      • displayInAppMessages

        public void displayInAppMessages(android.content.Context context)
        Invoke this method to display the in-app messages if present.
        Parameters:
        context - This is the Context of the application from getApplicationContext()
